item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3762; text as passed Senate: CR S3762; text of measure as introduced: CR S3750)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S3762; text as passed Senate: CR S3762; text of measure as introduced: CR S3750)

summary.text: Congratulates James Buckley (former U.S. Senator from New York) on the celebration of his 80th birthday and honors his contributions during his distinguished Government career.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on March 13, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Congratulates James Buckley (former U.S. Senator from New York) on the celebration of his 80th birthday and honors his contributions during his distinguished Government career.

bill.title: A resolution honoring the 80th birthday of James L. Buckley, former United States Senator for the state of New York.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
